channel.title: [PI] Command Help
channel.description:
Hello Everyone,
I need to make a command, that does the following.
1.) Give them full Dharoks 2.) Takes away 600 Pk Points 3.) If they don't have enough, it tells them 4.) Command is ::dharoks
Thanks, Rep ++ for help as always.

item.title: [PI] Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“aquikzebra, post:20, topic:397183”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=494335.msg3614246#msg3614246 date=1306848035]
This is for Project Insanity, guys; quit giving DeltaScape codes, here:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("dharoks")) { if (c.pkPoints < 600) { c.getItems().addItem(4716, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4718, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4720, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4722, 1); c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 600); } else { c.sendMessage("you do not have enough pk points for this item") } }
[/quote]

This is perfect,

Except I get this error…

http://prntscr.com/1z09q[/quote]

I fixed it in the code above.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

deans1243:

Well uncalled had the only right code here for pi, he used c.pkpoints and c.sendmessage you other people pi doesn’t use sM

Try and view it from a broad spectrum versus just one source, they all have the same objective but each one has different system functions. I see no point in giving code for one specific revision and it really doesn’t matter if his example included those methods because in my source I see it as both gross and terrible to have a sM message. Well getting off on another tangent in that sense; learn to use conventions everyone

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:16, topic:397183”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=494335.msg3614246#msg3614246 date=1306848035]
This is for Project Insanity, guys; quit giving DeltaScape codes, here:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("dharoks")) { if (c.pkPoints < 600) c.getItems().addItem(4716, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4718, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4720, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4722, 1); c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 600); } else { c.sendMessage("you do not have enough pk points for this item") } }
[/quote]
Your saying if you have less than 600 points you get those items? ;)[/quote]

Ikr, my example was perfectly fine if people could understand the words coming out of my mouth.
Ah yeah, AJ he also forgot a bracket on the 2nd line, the bracket after the else is also not necessary.

I guess my point is not to follow the leader into high waters; forge your own path with experience and try and create the code yourself.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Gazascape wrote:

Sorry But this is very rushed. Its 3:36 in the morning here and i cant get sleep, So if it doesent work, Dont blame me

however try it

} if(cmd[0].equals("dharoks")) { if('Pk Points' < 600) 'Send Message:' "You need 600 Pk Points to do this" } else { player.sm("You recieve dharoks full"); player.getInventory().addItem(4716, 1); player.getInventory().addItem(4718, 1); player.getInventory().addItem(4720, 1); player.getInventory().addItem(4722, 1);

Paste this somewhere suitable in commandpackethandler.java

Anyway you should know the command is somewhere along those lines, if theres anyone who sees this, they can correct it for me

@aquikzebra wrote:

Here what I can come up with,

if (playerCommand.startsWith("dharoks")) { c.getItems().addItem(4716, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4718, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4720, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4722, 1); check.(pk.points=-<600); c.sM("you do not have enough pk points for this item")

I know this is wrong, but it is the best I could come up with …

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:3, topic:397183”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=494335.msg3613829#msg3613829 date=1306808564]
Alright so break that down:

1).

-Send to their inventory the following items:
-Dharoks Plate
-Dharoks Legs
-(Other associated items)

2).

-Locate where the ‘Pk Points’ variable is stored, I am assuming that it is within a player entity of some sort.
'Pk Points'-=600;

3).

-Alright so a follow up to the last one.

[code]
if('Pk Points' < 600)
    'Send Message:' "You need 600 Pk Points to do this"
[/code]

4).

-In incoming command packet add a branch where if the command regix is equal to “dharoks” execute the code above.

Here is what it would look like in my mind; ignore the fact I used pseudocode.

if(cmd[0].equals("dharoks")) {
    if('Pk Points' < 600)
        'Send Message:' "You need 600 Pk Points to do this"
    else {
       -Send to their inventory the following items:
            -Dharoks Plate
            -Dharoks Legs
            -(Other associated items)
    }
}

Hope this helped, its the best I could do.
[/quote]

Well wtf is that? LOL! I see so much errors there.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Pseudocode

Pseudocode is an informal high-level description of the operating principle of a computer program or other algorithm. It uses the structural conventions of a normal programming language, but is intended for human reading rather than machine reading. Pseudocode typically omits details that are essential for machine understanding of the algorithm, such as variable declarations, system-specific code and some subroutines. The programming language is augmented with natural language description details...

To be considerably good at programming you must view it from a top level aspect versus saying ‘which component does this dis and dat’; considering that ‘component’ may not even be created yet. Programming is 10% knowledge, 20% syntax and 70% design.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Alright so break that down:

1).

-Send to their inventory the following items:
-Dharoks Plate
-Dharoks Legs
-(Other associated items)

2).

-Locate where the ‘Pk Points’ variable is stored, I am assuming that it is within a player entity of some sort.
'Pk Points'-=600;

3).

-Alright so a follow up to the last one.

[code]
if('Pk Points' < 600)
    'Send Message:' "You need 600 Pk Points to do this"
[/code]

4).

-In incoming command packet add a branch where if the command regix is equal to “dharoks” execute the code above.

Here is what it would look like in my mind; ignore the fact I used pseudocode.

if(cmd[0].equals("dharoks")) {
    if('Pk Points' < 600)
        'Send Message:' "You need 600 Pk Points to do this"
    else {
       -Send to their inventory the following items:
            -Dharoks Plate
            -Dharoks Legs
            -(Other associated items)
    }
}

Hope this helped, its the best I could do.
